_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:25:36 using v2.0
title: How has the proportion of abandoned ambulance calls changed?
analysis_commentary: The ambulance service keeps a count of how often people ring off before completing a call for an ambulance as a marker of slow telephone response times. The proportion of calls being abandoned has remained consistently very low, around 1.3%. However, there has been a very slight increase over time. The proportion peaked at 2.3% twice in August 2012 and December 2012. There is an increased volume of calls in December 2012 (around 131, 120 calls above the mean number over the time period), which may partially explain this peak, but no peak to this extent is seen in August 2012 (around 18,225 calls above the mean number over the time period).
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
